title: Pasta With White Beans and Arugula
summary: Pasta With White Beans and Arugula might be just the main course you are searching for. Watching your figure? This vegetarian recipe has 439 calories, 19g of protein, and 9g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 8 and costs $2.95 per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up lemon juice, basil, farfalle pasta, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 84%. This score is super. Similar recipes include Pasta With Arugula, White Beans, And Walnuts, Farfalle with Arugulan and White Beans, and Arugula Salad With White Beans And Pesto.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain. Stir together beans and next 7 ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in hot cooked pasta until blended.                                                                                                Pasta With Chickpeas, Tuna, and Arugula: Substitute 1 (16-oz.) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained, for cannellini beans. Stir in 3 (5-oz.) cans solid white tuna in water, drained.

Pasta With Chickpeas, Tuna, and Arugula: Substitute 1 (16-oz.) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained, for cannellini beans. Stir in 3 (5-oz.) cans solid white tuna in water, drained.
